title: Resolving the Hotdog-Sandwich Controversy

prerequisites: Secure buy-in from key stakeholder groups
steps.outcome: A legitimate, authoritative body to define food taxonomy standards
risks: Stakeholders may not agree on Council composition or decision-making process
Council may lack enforcement power over holdout groups

steps.action: Develop a Taxonomy Framework that Integrates Structural and Cultural Criteria
prerequisites: Comprehensive review of existing taxonomic models
steps.outcome: A classification system that balances objective structural analysis with subjective cultural considerations
risks: Framework may still leave ambiguous edge cases
Stakeholders may resist compromises that don't fully align with their views

prerequisites: Key stakeholders have agreed to participate in resolution process
steps.outcome: A fair, transparent process for adjudicating classification disagreements
risks: Stakeholders may still refuse to accept rulings that go against their positions
Dispute resolution process could become overly bureaucratic and slow

steps.action: Promote Public Education and Consensus-Building Campaigns
prerequisites: Taxonomy framework and dispute resolution mechanisms are in place
Funding and resources secured for public outreach
steps.outcome: Widespread public acceptance and internalization of the official food taxonomy
risks: Entrenched viewpoints may be difficult to change through education alone
Public may become fatigued by ongoing "food wars" messaging

prerequisites: Public has generally accepted the taxonomy framework
Dispute resolution process is functioning effectively
steps.outcome: Clear guidelines for restaurants, regulators, and consumers on how to properly identify and label hotdogs and sandwiches
risks: Some stakeholders may still resist any formal recognition of the opposing category
Standards may become overly complex or impractical to implement

resource_requirements: Funding for Council operations and public campaigns
Legal expertise to establish dispute resolution process
Culinary and linguistic experts to develop taxonomy framework
